p: Many Extension professionals embrace this broader public mission in various ways: promoting sustainable community food systems, including excluded groups, and partnering with organizations that advocate for the disenfranchised. Ostrom (2020) writes that “efforts to address inequalities of access are gaining momentum” in Extension and deserve more analysis (941). Some seek to make democracy work by facilitating conversations around contentious issues and building capacities to engage in democratic decision-making (Goerlich and Walker 2015; Peters et al. 2018). The efforts of many field-faculty along these lines deserve recognition.
